208.text:
roe the fallow do not tend to come bounding

there probably about 60 yards down into the

524.text:
12-year-olds can hit targets at 1,000 yards.
In this video, smart rifle manufacturer TrackingPoint

529.text:
shows a 12-year-old middle school student
from Texas hitting targets at 250, 500, 750

536.text:
and 1000 yards with a TrackingPoint .338 Lapua
Magnum long range hunting rifle. The rifle

541.text:
uses microelectronics, wireless technology
and an integral ballistics calculator for

547.text:
targeting, tracking, networking, and fire
control. Batteries not included.

553.text:
Nominations for the Countryside Alliance Awards,
also known as the Rural Oscars, closes on

558.text:
Friday 1st November 2013. The annual celebration
of rural businesses, produce and communities

564.text:
offers prizes in four categories and gives
a boost to rural communities. If you know

569.text:
of a worthy and inspiring rural business,
please nominate them now at CountrysideAllianceAwards.org.uk.

576.text:
The Scandinavian press is full of stories
as the annual elk hunt gets under way, probably

580.text: best not to read about it on the loo.

583.text:
This video of elk in urban areas has been
widely reported. In another story, a Norwegian

587.text:
shooter is guilty of not checking his backstop.
He aimed at an elk, missed it, and instead

592.text:
shot a man on a toilet in a wooden cabin.
The man's injuries are not life threatening

597.text:
and his wife says she forgives the hunter.
And a pastor and a newly licenced hunter gave

603.text:
the "elk hunt sermon" in a Swedish church
appeared wearing some unusual headwear.

609.text:
Dallas Safari Club is to auction a black rhino
hunting permit on behalf of the Namibian Government

616.text:
The hunt will generate around US$1 million
for rhino conservation efforts. When asked

621.text:
by outraged antis if the club would consider
a photo safari instead, a spokesman answered:

626.text:
"Well, that's great, but people don't pay
for that."

630.text:
Now when it comes to outraging antis and shooters
alike, you can't beat the birdhunters of the

637.text:
BirdLife Malta took this film of them shooting
a booted eagle. This is the 12th eagle shot

642.text:
on Malta this year, according to BirdLife
International, which is supported by Zeiss

647.text:
sports optics. Zeiss has donated a scopes
worth more than ú7,000 to help the organisation

652.text:
document illegal bird shooting during the
migration season.

657.text:
And finally, a man filming his fishing show
in Mexico thought he was home and dry - but

662.text: he didn't reckon on Pancho the local sealion.

trip by Mike ĹThe Griz' Ritz during filming

of a segment for his cable TV show Chef On
The Water. But it's Pancho who gets to eat

Next what happens when you get a high wind

711.text:
We're back at Plumpton College's student run-shoot
day. It's been 4 years since our last visit

718.text:
and we want to see how the gamekeeping course
is doing and, most importantly, whether the

722.text:
students are finding work. That will give
us a good idea of whether the shooting industry

727.text:
has wind in its sail or if it is bobbing about
in the doldrums.

here and why it's sold out quicker than a

a really nice informal atmosphere which is

Umm yes and no. You know because the banter

834.text:
entertaining other than that No it's just
like to turning up to day where there is a

917.text:
Now it's time to improve your gundog with
Skinner's gundog training experts

930.text:
It's all very well having your dog retrieve
bits of cloth and fluff but how do you keep

934.text:
them on the right lines when you start introducing
game.

937.text:
To start with we use cold game. I start by
usually cutting some wings off a dead, obviously,

945.text:
pheasant, taping them to a dummy, rabbit skin
on a dummy get them confident with that. Then

952.text:
into cold game, use cold game. We keep a freezer
full of as much game as we can get. Then you

961.text:
go onto the real thing. Today we are going
to go onto to getting the dog to try and take

965.text:
the line of a runner that has been shot. You'll
see how we do it by putting a shot today a

974.text:
rabbit, pheasant, whatever you want, going
round so the dog can't smell it. It's got

980.text:
to go down wind of where you drop it. You'll
see I walk round in a half circle with a rope

986.text:
drag the rabbit across the ground, bring the
dog out, send it to the fall what we have

993.text:
rubbed into the fall to make good blood scent
and then with the dog's experience we will

1000.text: get that the dog follows that blood scent.

1002.text: Why do you drag it on a rope?

1005.text:
Because I don't want to walk over where it
is going. Because then the dog could be following

1009.text:
my foot scent. We do it so the dog, it is
a fresh line, nothing has been over that line.

1015.text:
The dog has actually got to follow the scent,
not mine.

1018.text:
Tom runs Westhala Gundogs near Perth in Scotland.

I predict that in the near future people will
be saying OOY - - meaning 'Only On YouTube',

1183.text:
as in - chee - you'll never guess what they're
doing now. So here's our OOY of the week.

1189.text:
Our slingshot pal Joerg Sprave, featured on

1203.text:

Staying on rubber power, here's a fishing
video that makes you wonder how this Italian

1212.text:
can hold his breath for so long and with such
crazy signature graphics on the wetsuit. Our

1216.text: man goes to extraordinary depths to spearfish.

and sent me last week. This video is of the

1228.text:

1232.text:
Off to Northern Canada where TheWildNorth
is beaver hunting in a canoe - and successfully.

1237.text:
I like the way he tells the whole story of

1240.text:
More controversial, Tex Grebner sends in Cape
Buffalo Monster Speared. Tim Wells spears

1245.text:
a world record buff in Mozambique at four
yards. This film includes spearcam footage.

1251.text:
Finally, here's a new one on us. Have you
ever been squirrel calling? Bill Hays shows

1255.text:
how to do it using a mix of high pitched whistles
simulating a baby squirrel in distress and

1259.text:
clicking barks which are more of a challenge
sound. Always something to learn OOY.
